availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Jonathan Bates Dickson (Illinois, lieut 12th Ill Vols, capt in US AGO)

body.p: Illinois soldier. Massachusetts native. Son of Joshua G. Dickson and Sarah Dickson. Resident of Hamilton County, Ohio, in 1850. Enrolled as a freshman at Harvard College in Cambridge, Massachusetts, in 1851. Served in the 12th Illinois (Three Months') Volunteer Regiment (U.S.A.) as second lieutenant and first lieutenant from April 27, 1861, to May 1, 1862. Served in the Adjutant General's Office of the Department of the Ohio (U.S.A.) as captain from May 1, 1862, to June 24, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Ohio, Hamilton County, Mill Creek, p. 68A.
U.S. School Catalogs, 1765-1935, Harvard College, 1851, p. 35.
Annual Report of the Adjutant General of the State of IllinoisU.S. Adjustant General Military Records, 1631-1976, Illinois 1861-1862.
Heitman's Historical Register and Dictionary of the United States Army, from it's Organization, September 29, 1789, to March 2, 1903 p. 373.
Find A Grave, "Maj J. Bates Dickson (1833-1877)," Memorial #109784356, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/109784356 (accessed May 26, 2020).
